poemContent: Curled up into a circle, a quick, slick momentary trick, probably followed by a hit or flick Yet above the waist, a grave twisting of God’s rules Objection! Last mistake; the Sublime appals. Summoned up to the bright void of darkness, like some kind of sun stunned wasteland, a senate curs’d judgement day. Pleas to be released of your unattoned sins, your only escape, and for the jury it’s a mockery, a game There’s a chance of survival, yet it’s thin thinned like the eyes of the victim when you performed your trick How you wish it were penetrated, or Just a few centimetres more below the hip Fate lies near to the knuckle, here and now, or maybe slightly inbetween, Begging for some invisible-damned sicko’s reprimand,A reality that could only be orchestrated within Axel’s dream. 
